result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin A Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin A Jones in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Counts 1 and 2:    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties.  
As to Count 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 5 months in the House of Correction with credit of 1 day time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months.

As to Count 2:  Defendant ordered to serve 5 months in the House of Correction concurrent to Count 1.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months.

Conditions of probation: 
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
*Full-time work and/or school.
*No Contact with Sak's Off Fifth Avenue.
*Perform 25 hours of community service.
*Cognitive Intervention program.
*Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges, including DNA, during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes probation and pays all costs and surcharges.

Defendant Justin A Jones in court with attorney Robert J. Hampton.  Defendant Justin A Jones in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant out of town.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until a Projected Guilty Plea and Sentencing.    Parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be reassigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45 in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justin A Jones in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Morgan Willz for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested an adjournment of the Plea & Sentencing date. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justin A Jones in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Entry made without court file.  Case heard off the record.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justin A Jones in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held. Defense requests a scheduling conference date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Oral No Contact Order with Saks off 5th Avenue and the strip mall on 115th and Burleigh.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Justin A Jones in court.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 46  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5-18-2015 at 1:30pm
